Please check `cache_key_wrapper`: https://superset.apache.org/sqllab.html#superset.jinja_context.CacheKeyWrapper.cache_key_wrapper

Increasing the swap/memory did work for me (2GB swap, 4GB memory).  It did pause for 3-5 minutes on that same 92% chunk asset optimization TerserPlugin, but it moved past that step and finish successfully.

@bharath0208 I was getting the same error because an earlier version of Superset's docker  container was existing (although it was stopped). Deleting the image fixed it for me.

Thank Uï¼ï¼ï¼
I also need this function very much. At present, I solve this problem by developing custom data permissions through jinja template

> Please check `cache_key_wrapper`: https://superset.apache.org/sqllab.html#superset.jinja_context.CacheKeyWrapper.cache_key_wrapper

thanks

@justin-barton :
There are security problems in this plan: Use query filters to allow access to attribute values ,The current login user can delete the filter conditions in the query. If you do not give explore permission, the current user will lack the explore interaction function.

There are security problems in this plan: Use query filters to allow access to attribute values ,The current login user can delete the filter conditions in the query. If you do not give explore permission, the current user will lack the explore interaction function.

I'm experiencing the same issue, and the group by function works in SQL Lab. I'm only seeing this issue in my pivot tables. 

@mashciku have you found a workaround solution yet?
This is surely still an issue

Hi @willbarrett,
thanks for the info! Hmm that are not very good news for us. 
Does this mean that "sources > Druid Datasources" will disappear someday? And only the SQL Lab stays?

We are working with a lot of users who are not able to use SQL because their background is not IT. Having a user friendly interface where people can just click together their query is mandatory for us.

@mtoto not if you duplicate the whole dashboard. Superset duplicates also every single chart and from that point every new change will be directed to a specific chart, positioned either in the old or in your newly cloned dashboard.
Thanks @villebro. True it would be a nice to have, yet there is the challenge to send the reminder email attached to the email thread

I read some documentation and Stackoverflow Q&As, and I still can't find anything that indicates that SAP/HANA stores dates/datetimes/timestamps as `YYYYMMDD` strings. If your primary temporal column is in string format, you can create an expression that parses the string-based date/datetime/timestamp into a native date/datetime/timestamp value. Just select the table, click columns, add a new column, write the expression in the "expression" field and make sure to define the target type as "DATETIME" with a checkmark on the "Is temporal" field. After this you should be able to use that expression as your temporal column.
Thank you everyone for your help here. @ivansocket going to close this, feel free to reopen if the memory increase did not solved the issue
I meet this problem too, hope it can help me.

Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label `#bug` to this issue, with a confidence of 0.97. Please mark this comment with :thumbsup: or :thumbsdown: to give our bot feedback! 

 Links: [app homepage](https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot), [dashboard](https://mlbot.net/data/apache/incubator-superset) and [code](https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp) for this bot.
@Stephan3555 have you tried using the `Explore` view for this functionality? That section is designed to accommodate less-technical users.

I'm happy to see the scattered `.prettierrc` files disappear... I almost did that, but wasn't sure the history/emotions attached to those.

In the remaining `.prettierrc` I see the rules are to go with single quotes, and trailing commas. I like the trailing commas for commit/blame history. For quotes, I'd be inclined to go with Prettier's defaults, unless people feel passionate about those single quotes.
Yeah, I definitely would prefer to keep with the prettier defaults. I kept single quotes because that's what we have everywhere already, but i'm happy to drop that too
You can use SQL Lab (+new button > SQL Query) to write any sql you want, and then hit the "Explore" button to make a chart from your query.

A global redis-based pool would be very useful from a user perspective. Doing that in a future SIP makes a lot of sense though, since right now there is no connection limit at all.

I suggest avoiding offering any configuration in the UI until then, as a config intended to be applied per-process would be difficult to reliably translate to a global config.

Tables support HTML tags, so you could do some string manipulation in SQL and get <a> elements in your query results.
I think this is a valid issue, we should only show granularities for charts types which group-by time (time-series).  Having this displayed for non-time-series based charts is misleading.
@john-bodley are you thinking that the cascade deletes will also be soft/paranoid? In general I would be very in favor of moving to soft-deletes.

@willbarrett I think it depends on the entity type. For charts, dashboards, and datasources I think these should be soft-deletes, however cascade deletes are valid for removing columns/metrics once/if the datasource/table is hard deleted.

I think there's merit in enumerating which tables should support soft and cascading deletes.

Yup, there's pros and cons to both sides. Looks like @rusackas and I prefer Prettier defaults, and @graceguo-supercat prefers keeping the same. Let's try to get input from @mistercrunch, @betodealmeida, and/or @khtruong to try and find consensus?

Then I'll either revert the last commit or keep it depending on the result

Ok I was able to get this fixed and there was two issues.
One was that the `docker-entrypoint.sh` and `docker-init.sh` scripts both needed to be made executable (`chomd +x`) and both files also needed to have their line endings changes to unix (`dos2unix <filename>`).

EDIT: This wasn't the actual fix, see below
